author: fields93
content: I come from solidity dev/auditing but lack blockchain dev knowledge and I can't find rss about languages when checking the recommended readings from EPF github. Is there any recommended direction to follow? Appreciate it üôè

author: brycehytan
content:
The recommended reading list serves to provide knowledge about the blockchain protocol internals, which is important to understand how the Ethereum protocol works on the low level.

 Since the merge to the PoS network, the Ethereum protocol requires both an execution client and consensus Client to run. The clients are written in different programming languages to promote client diversity. These links serve as a good summary of all the different clients and state the languages they are written in: https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/nodes-and-clients/#execution-clients
https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/nodes-and-clients/#consensus-clients
